tit.cmt: 頭文字を大文字に変更

sen.j: たこ焼き（たこ焼、蛸焼、たこやき）は、小麦粉の生地の中にタコの小片を入れ直径3cm〜5cmほどの球に焼き上げた大阪発祥の料理である。
sen.e: Takoyaki is a baked ball of wheat flour of 3 to 5cm in diameter, into which a small piece of octopus is put, a dish originated in Osaka.
Takoyaki is a baked ball of wheat flour of three to five centimeters in diameter, into which a small piece of octopus is put, a dish originated in Osaka.
Takoyaki is a baked ball of wheat flour of three to five centimeters in diameter, into which a small piece of octopus is put, a dish originated in Osaka.

sen.j: おやつ・間食として食べる事が多い。
sen.e: It is usually eaten as treats or snacks.
It is usually eaten as a treat or snack.
It is usually eaten as a treat or snack.

sen.j: 一般的に爪楊枝または箸を用いて食べるが、注文の際に「何本?」と訊かれて3個ほど竹串に刺したものが供されるところもあった。
sen.e: You generally eat takoyaki using toothpicks or chopsticks, but in some stores you are asked, "How many sticks do you want?" when you order, and three pieces of takoyaki, pierced by a bamboo stick, are served.

You generally eat takoyaki using toothpicks or chopsticks, but in some stores you are asked, "How many sticks do you want?" when you order, and three pieces of takoyaki, pierced by a bamboo stick, are served.

You generally eat takoyaki using toothpicks or chopsticks, but in some stores you are asked, 'How many sticks do you want?' when you order, and three pieces of takoyaki, pierced by a bamboo stick, are served.
sen.cmt: シングルクォーテーションに変更

sen.j: 現在ではそうした串たこ焼きは愛知県瀬戸市に販売する店がある。
sen.e: Today you can eat takoyaki with a bamboo stick as stated above in stores located in Seto City, Aichi Prefecture.
Today you can eat takoyaki with a bamboo stick as stated above in stores located in Seto City, Aichi Prefecture.
Today you can eat takoyaki with a bamboo stick as stated above in stores located in Seto City, Aichi Prefecture.

sen.j: 店の数は大阪が圧倒的に多い。
sen.e: Osaka has by far the largest number of takoyaki restaurants.
Osaka has by far the largest number of takoyaki restaurants.
Osaka has by far the largest number of takoyaki restaurants.

sen.j: たこ焼きと同時にお好み焼きを扱う店舗も多く、初詣や祭り等では屋台も多く現れる。
sen.e: Many takoyaki restaurants also serve okonomiyaki (savory pancake with various ingredients), and at the time of Hatsumode (the first pray at Shinto shrine and/or temple on the of the new year days) and festivals, many food wagons dealing in takoyaki are set up.

Many takoyaki restaurants also serve okonomiyaki (savory pancake with various ingredients), and at the time of Hatsumode (the first prayer at Shinto shrine and/or temple of the new year) and festivals, many food wagons dealing in takoyaki are set up.

Many takoyaki restaurants also serve okonomiyaki (savory pancake with various ingredients), and at the time of Hatsumode (the first prayer at Shinto shrine and/or temple of the new year) and festivals, many food wagons dealing in takoyaki are set up.

sen.j: 店内飲食のテーブル席を設けた店舗も多くあるが、ほとんどの店舗はテイクアウトができ、持ち帰り専門の店舗も少なくない。
sen.e: A lot of stores have an eat-in corner with several tables, but most stores offer takeout takoyaki, and there are not a few "takeout only"stores.
A lot of stores have an eat-in corner with several tables, but most stores offer takeout takoyaki, and there are many "takeout only"stores.
A lot of stores have an eat-in corner with several tables, but most stores offer takeout takoyaki, and there are many "takeout only"stores.

sen.j: また最近では商業施設のテナントとして、たこ焼き専門の店も多く進出している。
sen.e: An increasing number of tenants specialized in takoyaki are beginning to operate in commercial complexes these days.
An increasing number of tenants specialized in takoyaki are beginning to operate in commercial complexes these days.
An increasing number of tenants specialized in takoyaki are beginning to operate in commercial complexes these days.

sen.j: 特に都市のスーパーマーケットでは、たこ焼きをつくる店が入り口付近に店を構え、買い物ついでに集客している。
sen.e: Especially in supermarkets in big cities, takoyaki restaurants, located near the entrance, attract shoppers who visit the supermarket.
Especially in supermarkets in big cities, takoyaki restaurants, located near the entrance, attract shoppers who visit the supermarket.
Especially in supermarkets in big cities, takoyaki restaurants, located near the entrance, attract shoppers who visit the supermarket.

sen.j: この他、昭和時代から子供が多く集まる駄菓子店などでも焼かれている事があるが、そのような店は減少傾向にある。
sen.e: In addition, some mom-and-pop candy stores, which have been popular with children since the Showa period, still serve takoyaki but the number of such stores is decreasing.
In addition, some mom-and-pop candy stores, which have been popular with children since the Showa period, still serve takoyaki but the number of such stores is decreasing.
In addition, some mom-and-pop candy stores, which have been popular with children since the Showa period, still serve takoyaki but the number of such stores is decreasing.

sen.j: 「大阪ではたこ焼き用鉄板は嫁入り道具の一つ」と誇張したことが言われる程、大阪出身の家庭でのたこ焼き用の鉄板や道具の所持率、男女を問わずたこ焼きの作り方を知っている人が多い事からみても、たこ焼きの人気は高いものである。
sen.e: Judging from the remarkably high percentage of families from Osaka which possess an iron plate and other tools for cooking takoyaki, and from the large number of people in Osaka, both women and men, who know how to cook takoyaki, the popularity of takoyaki is so great in Osaka that people say exaggeratingly, "An iron plate for cooking takoyaki is one of brides' household articles in Osaka."

Judging from the remarkably high percentage of families from Osaka that possess an iron plate and other tools for cooking takoyaki, and from the large number of people in Osaka, both men and women, who know how to cook takoyaki, the popularity of takoyaki is so great in Osaka that people say exaggerate, "An iron plate for cooking takoyaki is one of brides' household articles in Osaka."

Judging from the remarkably high percentage of families from Osaka that possess an iron plate and other tools for cooking takoyaki, and from the large number of people in Osaka, both men and women, who know how to cook takoyaki, the popularity of takoyaki is so great in Osaka that people say exaggerate, 'An iron plate for cooking takoyaki is one of brides' household articles in Osaka.'
sen.cmt: シングルクォーテーションに変更

sen.j: この為、たこ焼きには欠かせない小さく角形に刻んだ紅生姜などは、近畿圏では昭和の中頃から瓶詰めにして多くの店で販売されていた。
sen.e: This is why red pickled ginger cut in very small cubes, which is an ingredient essential to takoyaki, has been sold in a bottle at many stores in the Kinki region since the middle of the Showa period.

This is why red pickled ginger cut in very small cubes, which is an ingredient essential to takoyaki, has been sold in a bottle at many stores in the Kinki region since the middle of the Showa period.

This is why red pickled ginger cut in very small cubes, which is an ingredient essential to takoyaki, has been sold in a bottle at many stores in the Kinki region since the middle of the Showa period.

sen.j: 近年は小麦粉に隠し味的な調味料やベーキングパウダーなど、場合によっては細かい乾燥紅しょうがなどの具がブレンドされた「たこ焼き粉」という専用の粉も発売されている。
sen.e: Nowadays, special powder named "octopus dumpling powder," wheat flour into which a hidden flavor of seasoning, baking powder and sometimes red pickled ginger dried and ground to a fine powder are blended, is on sale.

Nowadays, special powder named "octopus dumpling powder," wheat flour into which a hidden flavor of seasoning, baking powder and sometimes red pickled ginger dried and ground to a fine powder are blended, is on sale.

Nowadays, special powder named 'takoyaki-ko' (octopus dumpling powder), wheat flour into which a hidden flavor of seasoning, baking powder and sometimes red pickled ginger dried and ground to a fine powder are blended, is on sale.
sen.cmt: 表記統一のため、"octopus dumpling powder"→'takoyaki-ko' (octopus dumpling powder)としました。

sen.j: たこ焼きのウスターソースとしては家庭ではお好み焼きソースで代用することが多いが、「たこ焼きソース」として専用のソースも発売されている。
sen.e: Sauce for okonomiyaki is substituted for Worcester sauce for takoyaki in many families, but sauce exclusively for takoyaki is on sale.
Sauce for okonomiyaki is substituted for Worcester sauce for takoyaki in many families, but sauce exclusively for takoyaki is on sale.
Sauce for okonomiyaki is substituted for Worcester sauce for takoyaki in many families, but sauce exclusively for takoyaki is on sale.

sen.j: 最近では冷凍食品も発売されるようになった。
sen.e: Today you can get frozen takoyaki.
Today you can get frozen takoyaki.
Today you can get frozen takoyaki.

sen.j: またタコ以外にチーズなどを具にしたものも登場している。
sen.e: Some takoyaki contains cheese instead of octopus.
Some takoyaki contains cheese instead of octopus.
Some takoyaki contain cheese instead of octopus.

sen.j: 京都や関東などでは刻みキャベツを入れるなどのものも存在する。
sen.e: Some takoyaki also contains shredded cabbage in Kyoto and Kanto.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Some takoyaki also contains shredded cabbage in Kyoto and Kanto.
Some takoyaki also contain shredded cabbage in Kyoto and Kanto.

sen.j: しかし、たこ焼きの生地はお好み焼きに比べると非常に（小麦粉の濃度が）薄く、キャベツを入れるとかなり固めに焼かなければ固まらなくなるため、大阪で好まれるとろみのある食感は出せなくなる。
sen.e: However, the dough of takoyaki is diluted with more water than that of okonomiyaki and resists caking, with cabbage added to it, until it is baked thoroughly, and so the creamy texture which is loved in Osaka will be lost.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: However, the dough of takoyaki is diluted with more water than that of okonomiyaki and resists caking, with cabbage added to it, until it is baked thoroughly, and so the creamy texture which is loved in Osaka is lost.

However, the dough of takoyaki is diluted with more water than that of okonomiyaki and resists caking, with cabbage added to it, until it is baked thoroughly, and so the creamy texture which is loved in Osaka is lost.

sen.j: 日本国外に進出したたこ焼き店も見られるが、地中海沿岸地域（南ヨーロッパ）やメキシコ以外ではタコを食べる習慣がないため、現地で受け入れられるような食材を代わりに入れるか、あるいは具を入れないで焼き上げたものが売られている場合がある。
sen.e: Takoyaki is sold outside Japan, but people except Mediterranean population (in southern Europe) or Mexicans have no custom of eating octopus, and sometimes takoyaki without octopus or with alternative ingredients acceptable to local people is offered.

Takoyaki is sold outside Japan, but people except for the Mediterranean population (in southern Europe) or Mexicans have no custom of eating octopus, and sometimes takoyaki without octopus or with alternative ingredients acceptable to local people is offered.

Takoyaki is sold outside Japan, but people except for the Mediterranean population (in southern Europe) or Mexicans have no custom of eating octopus, and sometimes takoyaki without octopus or with alternative ingredients acceptable to local people is offered.

sen.j: たこ焼きを盛り付けるか入れる使い捨ての容器は、薄く削いだ木（経木）によるボート形の皿が一般的だが、紙製・発泡スチロールの容器、薄いプラスチックの容器などもある。
sen.e: One-trip containers on or into which takoyaki is put are mostly boat-shaped trays made of paper-thin sheets of wood (kyogi), but some containers are made of paper, styrene foam or thin plastic sheets.

One-trip containers on or into which takoyaki is put are mostly boat-shaped trays made of paper-thin sheets of wood (kyogi), but some containers are made of paper, styrene foam or thin plastic sheets.

One-trip containers on or into which takoyaki is put are mostly boat-shaped trays made of paper-thin sheets of wood (kyogi), but some containers are made of paper, styrene foam or thin plastic sheets.

sen.j: 持ち帰りでは舟形の容器を包装紙で包むか舟形の容器をさらに薄いプラスチックの容器に入れる。
sen.e: When you order takeout takoyaki, the container is wrapped in wrapping paper, or put in another container made of slim plastic sheets.
When you order takeout takoyaki, the container is wrapped in wrapping paper, or put in another container made of slim plastic sheets.
When you order takeout takoyaki, the container is wrapped in wrapping paper, or put in another container made of slim plastic sheets.

sen.j: なお、楊枝は大抵2本付属しており、2本で一人分である。
sen.e: Generally, along with takoyaki, toothpicks are offered in a pair.
Generally, along with takoyaki, toothpicks are offered in a pair.
Generally, along with takoyaki, toothpicks are offered in a pair.

sen.j: 理由は回転することを防ぐためとも言われる。
sen.e: This is presumably because takoyaki will not rotate if you pierce it with two toothpicks.
This is presumably because takoyaki will not rotate if you pierce it with two toothpicks.
This is presumably because takoyaki will not rotate if you pierce it with two toothpicks.

sen.j: 専門店のたこ焼きは、表面の皮状の部分が薄くやや堅い状態に焼け、内部がもんじゃ焼きのようにとろみのあるものが人気がある。
sen.e: Popular takoyaki in takoyaki restaurants has thin and rather hard surface croute, and its center is typically as creamy as Monjayaki (a type of Japanese pan-fried batter with various ingredients).
Popular takoyaki in takoyaki restaurants have a thin and rather hard surface croute, and its center is typically as creamy as Monjayaki (a type of Japanese pan-fried batter with various ingredients).
Popular takoyaki in takoyaki restaurants have a thin and rather hard surface croute, and its center is typically as creamy as Monjayaki (a type of Japanese pan-fried batter with various ingredients).

sen.j: ただし本場の大阪では外側のクリスピーな食感は好まれず、表面の皮状の部分も柔らかく、成形した形を保てる限度の焼き加減が好まれる。
sen.e: But in Osaka, the home of takoyaki, people do not like takoyaki with crispy surface, but prefer soft surface croute, baked only to the extent that the croute is barely able to keep its shape.
But in Osaka, the home of takoyaki, people do not like takoyaki with a crispy surface, but prefer soft surface croute, baked only to the extent that the croute is barely able to keep its shape.
But in Osaka, the home of takoyaki, people do not like takoyaki with a crispy surface, but prefer soft surface croute, baked only to the extent that the croute is barely able to keep its shape.

sen.j: 昭和40年代になると、関東地方でも屋台での販売が見られるようになる。
sen.e: Since around 1965, food wagons selling takoyaki have been observed in the Kanto region.
Since around 1965, food wagons selling takoyaki have been observed in the Kanto region.
Since around 1965, food wagons selling takoyaki have been observed in the Kanto region.

sen.j: 東京・銀座では生地にエビのすり身を入れたたこ焼きの屋台が独特の風味で人気を博した。
sen.e: Some food wagons in Ginza, Tokyo offered takoyaki with minced shrimp mixed into it, and it became very popular due to its original flavor.
Some food wagons in the Ginza, Tokyo offered takoyaki with minced shrimp mixed into it, and it became very popular due to its original flavor.
Some food wagons in the Ginza, Tokyo offered takoyaki with minced shrimp mixed into it, and it became very popular due to its original flavor.

sen.j: 1990年代中盤から、京たこをはじめとするチェーン店のたこ焼き店が、渋谷センター街などの東京都に数多く進出し、一大ブームとなった。
sen.e: In the mid-1990s a lot of chain takoyaki restaurants including Kyotako entered into Shibuya Center-Gai and other areas in Tokyo, and created a big takoyaki boom.
In the mid-1990s a lot of chain takoyaki restaurants including Kyotako entered into Shibuya Center-Gai and other areas in Tokyo, and created a big takoyaki boom.
In the mid-1990s a lot of chain takoyaki restaurants including Kyotako entered into Shibuya Center-Gai and other areas in Tokyo, and created a big takoyaki boom.

sen.j: 2000年頃、築地銀だこが全国展開した。
sen.e: Around 2000, Tsukiji Gindaco began to expand its business throughout Japan.
Around 2000, Tsukiji Gindaco began to expand its business throughout Japan.
Around 2000, Tsukiji Gindaco began to expand its business throughout Japan.

sen.j: 「銀だこ」の名を使ったたこ焼き味のスナック菓子も作られた。
sen.e: Snacks with a flavor of takoyaki went on sale under the name of "Gindaco."
Snacks with the flavor of takoyaki went on sale under the name of "Gindaco."

sen.j: 2000年以降、近畿地方以外に展開するチェーン店が増加している。
sen.e: Since 2000, an increasing number of takoyaki restaurant chains have begun to expand into regions other than Kinki.
Since 2000, an increasing number of takoyaki restaurant chains have begun to expand into regions other than Kinki.
Since 2000, an increasing number of takoyaki restaurant chains have begun to expand into regions other than Kinki.

sen.j: 一方、関西圏でもたこ以外の具材を入れたたこ焼き、ソースに工夫を凝らしたたこ焼き、スープやうどんなどに入れて販売するたこ焼きなど、多様性に富むようになっている。
sen.e: On the other hand, varieties of takoyaki are appearing in the Kinki region, including takoyaki with ingredients other than octopus, takoyaki with different special sauces, and takoyaki served in a soup or udon (Japanese wheat noodle).

On the other hand, varieties of takoyaki are appearing in the Kinki region, including takoyaki with ingredients other than octopus, takoyaki with different special sauces, and takoyaki served in a soup or udon (Japanese wheat noodle).

sen.j: 2002年には株式会社ラプレ社長の上谷信幸プロデュースによるコンパクトディスク「たこやきのうた」（歌：宇高香里とたこボールキッズ）がインディーズで発売され、大阪を中心に出荷枚数は1万枚を突破している。
sen.e: In 2002, an indie song titled "The Song of Takoyaki" (sung by Kaori UTAKA and Tako Ball Kids), produced by Nobuyuki KAMITANI, the president of Raple Co., Ltd., was released and its CD has sold more than ten thousand copies particularly in Osaka.

sen.j: 表面にソースが塗られているものが主流である。
sen.e: Typically, takoyaki is served with sauce spread over it.
Typically, takoyaki is served with sauce spread over it.
Typically, takoyaki is served with sauce spread over it.

sen.j: 通常は青海苔と鰹節がまぶされ、好みによってさらにこれにマヨネーズをかける。
sen.e: It is usually dusted with aonori (dried powdered seaweed) and dried bonito shavings, and sometimes smothered in mayonnaise if you like it.
It is usually dusted with aonori (dried powdered seaweed) and dried bonito shavings, and sometimes smothered in mayonnaise if you like it.
It is usually dusted with aonori (dried powdered seaweed) and dried bonito shavings, and sometimes smothered in mayonnaise if you like it.

sen.j: 焼き上げられた後にソースなど調味料が塗られていない場合、なにも調味料をつけないで食べる（本体に味付されている場合は何もつけられず供される）ほか、食べる際に醤油、最近ではポン酢や食塩で味付けして食べることもある。
sen.e: If no seasonings are added to takoyaki after it is finished, you can eat it without any seasonings, (Takoyaki is usually served without seasonings when it already has some tastes.) or you can eat it after adding soy sauce, or ponzu sauce or salt these days.

sen.j: 表面に醤油が塗られているものが、名古屋地方に多くみられる。
sen.e: In an area around Nagoya, soy sauce is often spread on the surface of takoyaki.
Around Nagoya, soy sauce is often spread on the surface of takoyaki.
Around Nagoya, soy sauce is often spread on the surface of takoyaki.

sen.j: 塩味を付けた澄まし汁のようなだし汁（主として鰹節だし）に浸した状態で供される。
sen.e: When it is served, it is immersed in clear, salted dashi broth soup (mainly made from small pieces of sliced dried bonito).
When it is served, it is immersed in clear, salted dashi broth soup (mainly made from small pieces of sliced dried bonito).

sen.j: 神戸市西部から姫路市あたりにみられ、明石焼きに強く影響を受けたものである。
sen.e: This style of takoyaki, strongly influenced by "Akashi-yaki," is more common in an area between the west of Kobe City and Himeji City.

sen.j: さらにそれにソースを塗って食べることもある。

sen.j: 玉子焼_(明石市)（玉子焼）
sen.e: Japanese style omelet (Akashi City)

sen.j: 卵の比率が多いたこ焼きと同様の食品をまな板状の木皿に並べて、澄まし汁状の出汁に浸しながら食べるもの。
sen.e: Baked balls of wheat flour which resemble takoyaki but contain more egg than takoyaki are served lining up on a wooden plate similar to Manaita, and you dip them into clear dashi broth soup before you eat them.

Baked balls of wheat flour that resemble takoyaki, but contain more egg than takoyaki are served lined up on a wooden plate similar to Manaita, and you dip them into clear dashi broth soup before you eat them.

sen.j: 薬味にはミツバが用いられることが多い。
sen.e: In most cases, mitsuba (Japanese honewort) is added to the soup as condiments.

sen.j: 兵庫県南部から大阪市にかけての地域に多くみられる。
sen.e: They are more common in an area between the southern part of Hyogo Prefecture and Osaka City.

sen.j: 明石市では「明石焼き」と言わず、「玉子焼」と呼ぶ。
sen.e: In Akashi City, they are called "tamago-yaki (omelet)" instead of "Akashi-yaki."

sen.j: いろんな店の店員や、家庭でよく作る人たちの意見を大まかにまとめると、以下のようになる。
sen.e: The following is a rough summary of opinions heard from clerks of different takoyaki restaurants and from people who often make takoyaki at home.

sen.j: もっとも、たこ焼きは店や作る人によって流儀やこだわりがあり、これが全てではない。
sen.e: But this is not a complete recipe of takoyaki, because there are different styles and peculiar tastes for takoyaki according to restaurants and people who make it.
But this is not a complete recipe of takoyaki, because there are different styles and peculiar tastes for takoyaki according to restaurants and people who make it.
But this is not a complete recipe of takoyaki, because there are different styles and peculiar tastes for takoyaki according to restaurants and people who make it.

sen.j: 規格や規定があるわけではないので明確な出典や資料を示すことは不可能である。
sen.e: As there are no definite standards or definitions, it is impossible to name specific sources or supporting data.
As there are no definite standards or definitions, it is impossible to name specific sources or supporting data.
As there are no definite standards or definitions, it is impossible to name specific sources or supporting data.

sen.j: 小麦粉と卵を水またはだし汁で溶く。
sen.e: Dissolve flour and eggs in water or dashi broth soup. (You should keep the water or soup as cool as possible in order to suppress the formation of gluten. Some stores use ice water.)
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Dissolve flour and eggs in water or dashi broth soup. (You should keep the water or soup as cool as possible in order to suppress the formation of gluten. Some stores use ice water.)
Dissolve flour and eggs in water or dashi broth soup.

sen.j: （グルテンの生成を抑える為、温度は低い方がよい。店によっては氷水を使う店もある）
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: (You should keep the water or soup as cool as possible in order to suppress the formation of gluten. Some stores use ice water.)

sen.j: 粘度が高く濃い状態～薄く粘度の低い状態になる程度に溶いて生地を作る。
sen.e: Dissolve them until they become something between very thick to very thin, and use them as the dough.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Dissolve until they become something between very thick to very thin, and use it as the dough.
Dissolve until they become something between very thick to very thin, and use it as the dough.

sen.j: 生地に少量のすり下ろしたとろろを加える場合もある（店によってはこの後半日寝かす。ふんわりと仕上げるには寝かした方が良い、とのこと）。
sen.e: In some cases, a small amount of grated yam is added to the dough. (After this, some stores leave the dough for half a day. They say it is necessary to leave the dough for a while in order to make fluffy takoyaki.)

In some cases, a small amount of grated yam is added to the dough. (After this, some stores leave the dough for half a day. They say it is necessary to leave the dough for a while in order to make fluffy takoyaki.)

In some cases, a small amount of grated yam is added to the dough. (After this, some stores leave the dough for half a day. They say it is necessary to leave the dough for a while in order to make fluffy takoyaki.)

sen.j: この溶き具合はたこ焼きの要で、濃すぎると団子のような焼き上がりになり、薄すぎると焼いているうちに水分が逃げて縮んでしまう。
sen.e: The viscosity of the dough is a key point in making takoyaki; if it is too thick, takoyaki will taste like dango (sweet rice dumpling); on the other hand, if it is too thin, moisture will evaporate from the dough while it is heated and takoyaki will shrink.

The viscosity of the dough is a key point in making takoyaki; if it is too thick, takoyaki will taste like dango (sweet rice dumpling); on the other hand, if it is too thin, moisture will evaporate from the dough while it is heated and takoyaki will shrink.

The viscosity of the dough is a key point in making takoyaki; if it is too thick, takoyaki will taste like dango (sweet rice dumpling); on the other hand, if it is too thin, moisture will evaporate from the dough while it is heated and takoyaki will shrink.

sen.j: お好み焼きより遙かにシビアな溶き加減を要求される。
sen.e: Far more delicate adjustment of viscosity is required for the dough of takoyaki than for that of okonomiyaki.
A far more delicate adjustment of viscosity is required for the dough of takoyaki than for that of okonomiyaki.
A far more delicate adjustment of viscosity is required for the dough of takoyaki than for that of okonomiyaki.

sen.j: なお、お好み焼き粉と同様に、だしやとろろ芋が最適な状態でブレンドされた「たこ焼き粉」もスーパーなどで入手でき、特にこだわりがなければ十分である。
sen.e: However, just as in the case of okonomiyaki, you can purchase "takoyaki-ko (octopus dumpling powder)," wheat flour mixed with dashi broth soup and grated yam in perfect condition, at the supermarket, and it will do as long as you are not very particular about the taste of takoyaki.

However, just as in the case of okonomiyaki, you can purchase "takoyaki-ko (octopus dumpling powder)," wheat flour mixed with dashi broth soup and grated yam in perfect condition, at the supermarket, and it will do as long as you are not very particular about the taste of takoyaki.

However, just as in the case of okonomiyaki, you can purchase 'takoyaki-ko,' wheat flour mixed with dashi broth soup and grated yam in perfect condition, at the supermarket, and it will do as long as you are not very particular about the taste of takoyaki.
sen.cmt: 既出のため、takoyaki-koの補足削除、シングルクォーテーションに変更

sen.j: 半球のくぼみが多数付いた専用の鉄板を専用コンロで加熱して、刷毛等で食用油を引き、くぼみの中へ生地をひたひたになるまで流し込む。
sen.e: Heat up a special iron plate with many hemispheric dents on it by using a special stove, apply cooking oil on the plate with a brush, and pour the dough into the dents until they almost overflow.
Heat up a special iron plate with many hemispheric dents on it using a special stove, apply cooking oil on the plate with a brush, and pour the dough into the dents until they almost overflow.
Heat up a special iron plate with many hemispheric dents on it using a special stove, apply cooking oil on the plate with a brush, and pour the dough into the dents until they almost overflow.

sen.j: 続いて細かく切ったゆで蛸を入れ、紅生姜・天かす・をざっと振りかけるように素早く入れる。
sen.e: Then put octopus, boiled and cut into small cubes, into each dent and quickly scatter red pickled ginger and tenkasu (crunchy bits of deep-fried dough produced as a byproduct of cooking tempura) onto it.

Then put octopus, boiled and cut into small cubes, into each dent and quickly scatter red pickled ginger and tenkasu (crunchy bits of deep-fried dough produced as a byproduct of cooking tempura) onto it.

Then put octopus, boiled and cut into small cubes, into each dent and quickly scatter red pickled ginger and tenkasu (crunchy bits of deep-fried dough produced as a byproduct of cooking tempura) onto it.

sen.j: ネギや乾物エビ（オキアミ・サクラエビなど）を加えることもある。
sen.e: You can further add green onion and dried shrimps such as krill and small pink shrimps.
You can further add green onions and dried shrimp such as krill and small pink shrimps.
You can further add green onions and dried shrimp such as krill and small pink shrimps.

sen.j: 裏面が薄く膜状に焼けてきたら専用の千枚通しのような道具でひっくり返す。
sen.e: When the bottom of the dough roasts to the extent that a thin skin is beginning to form on the surface, turn it over with a special tool which looks like an eyeleteer (a bodkin).
When the bottom of the dough roasts to the extent that a thin skin is beginning to form on the surface, turn it over with a special tool which looks like an eyeleteer (a bodkin).
When the bottom of the dough roasts to the extent that a thin skin is beginning to form on the surface, turn it over with a special tool which looks like an eyeleteer (a bodkin).

sen.j: すると中のまだ固まっていない溶き粉が鉄板側に流れ球形になる。
sen.e: Then, the dough inside the skin, which is still soft and creamy, will flow into the dent and form a ball.
Then, the dough inside the skin, which is still soft and creamy, will flow into the dent and form a ball.
Then, the dough inside the skin, which is still soft and creamy, will flow into the dent and form a ball.

sen.j: 反対面が焼けてくるとまた専用具でひっくり返し、ボール状に整える。
sen.e: When the other side of the dough begins to roast, turn it over again with the eyeleteer and make it into a perfect ball.
When the other side of the dough begins to roast, turn it over again with the eyeleteer and make it into a perfect ball.
When the other side of the dough begins to roast, turn it over again with the eyeleteer and make it into a perfect ball.

sen.j: 何度もひっくり返ししすぎないのが内部をとろみのある状態に仕上げるコツであるが、それには前述のように最適な溶き具合も要求される。
sen.e: If you want to make takoyaki with creamy center, you had better avoid turning it over too often, in addition to taking much care of the viscosity of the dough.
If you want to make takoyaki with a creamy center, you had better avoid turning it over too often, in addition to taking much care of the viscosity of the dough.
If you want to make takoyaki with a creamy center, you had better avoid turning it over too often, in addition to taking much care of the viscosity of the dough.

sen.j: キツネ色に香ばしく焼き上がったら小皿に盛り付ける。
sen.e: Arrange takoyaki on a small dish when it is baked until it turns light brown and becomes savory.
Arrange takoyaki on a small dish when it is baked until it turns light brown and becomes savory.
Arrange takoyaki on a small dish when it is baked until it turns light brown and becomes savory.

sen.j: 表面は少し固く、中は完全に固まらずクリーム状にとろみのある状態が上手い焼き方である。
sen.e: It is most delicious when the surface is a little solid and the center is creamy, not completely solidified.
It is most delicious when the surface is a little solid and the center is creamy, not completely solidified.
It is most delicious when the surface is a little solid and the center is creamy, not completely solidified.

sen.j: ソースを上に塗る（好みによってマヨネーズをかける）。
sen.e: Spread sauce over takoyaki (and add mayonnaise if you like it).
Spread sauce over the takoyaki (and add mayonnaise if you like it).
Spread sauce over the takoyaki (and add mayonnaise if you like it).

sen.j: 鰹節と青海苔をかけ完成。
sen.e: Finally, dust takoyaki with dried bonito shavings and aonori.
Finally, dust takoyaki with dried bonito shavings and aonori.
Finally, dust takoyaki with dried bonito shavings and aonori.

sen.j: 特に近畿圏において、たこ焼き用の凹みのついた調理器具は「たこ焼き器」と呼ばれる。
sen.e: Particularly in the Kinki region, cooking devices with dents in which takoyaki is to be baked are called "Takoyaki-ki (devices for takoyaki)."

sen.j: 一定の時間が来ると鉄板が細かく振動し、たこ焼きが回転する。
sen.e: The iron plate vibrates slightly after a lapse of specified time, rotating takoyaki.
The iron plate vibrates slightly after a lapse of specified time, rotating takoyaki.

sen.j: 本体は鉄の鋳物製が多く見られるが、銅製を好む人もいる。
sen.e: The main body is mostly made of cast iron, but some people prefer a copper body.
The main body is mostly made of cast iron, but some people prefer a copper body.

sen.j: 明石焼きにおいては基本的に銅製を用いる。
sen.e: When you make Akashi-yaki, a device with a copper body is basically used.
When you make Akashi-yaki, a device with a copper body is basically used.

sen.j: 形状は写真のような角型や丸型がある。
sen.e: Takoyaki-ki is either square or round-shaped, as shown in the photographs.
Takoyaki-ki is either square or round-shaped, as shown in the photographs.
Takoyaki-ki is either square or round-shaped, as shown in the photographs.

sen.j: 古いタイプの丸形のたこ焼き器は、火力に練炭火鉢を使用するため、大きさもこの大きさに合わせた物となっている。
sen.e: Round-shaped takoyaki-ki of the old type is large enough to accommodate a charcoal stove because it is heated by the stove.
Round-shaped takoyaki-ki of the old type is large enough to accommodate a charcoal stove because it is heated by the stove.
Round-shaped Takoyaki-ki of the old type is large enough to accommodate a charcoal stove because it is heated by the stove.

sen.j: たこ焼きを裏返すための串は、手元が熱いため串先の長い専用のものがある。
sen.e: There are sticks exclusively for turning over takoyaki, which are very long (except the grip) because otherwise you might have your hand burnt when you turn over takoyaki.
There are sticks exclusively for turning over takoyaki, which are very long (except for the grip) because otherwise you might burn your hand when you turn over takoyaki.
There are sticks exclusively for turning over takoyaki, which are very long (except for the grip) because otherwise you might burn your hand when you turn over takoyaki.

sen.j: 店によっては、たこ焼き器が傷つかないように竹製の菜箸（ただし1本）を使うことも多い。
sen.e: Some stores use a serving chopstick made of bamboo (not a pair of chopsticks but a chopstick) instead of a stick, in order not to damage takoyaki-ki.
Some stores use a serving chopstick made of bamboo (not a pair of chopsticks but, a chopstick) instead of a stick, in order not to damage takoyaki-ki.
Some stores use a serving chopstick made of bamboo (not a pair of chopsticks but, a chopstick) instead of a stick, in order not to damage Takoyaki-ki.

sen.j: 家庭では一般的な千枚通しでも代用できる。
sen.e: At home, an ordinary eyeleteer can be substituted for a stick.
At home, an ordinary eyeleteer can be substituted for a stick.
At home, an ordinary eyeleteer can be substituted for a stick.

sen.j: 油引き用の刷毛は凹みにちょうど入る形状をしている。
sen.e: A brush for applying cooking oil is designed to fit in dents of an iron plate for takoyaki.
A brush for applying cooking oil is designed to fit in dents of an iron plate for takoyaki.
A brush for applying cooking oil is designed to fit in dents of an iron plate for takoyaki.

sen.j: なお、古いスタイルではたこ焼きを裏返さず、片面だけ焼き、たこ焼き器ごと裏返して、対となる鉄板の上にかぶせる。
sen.e: Old-style takoyaki is not turned over; you bake hemispheres of takoyaki, turn over takoyaki-ki itself and make the two corresponding iron plates face each other.
Old-style takoyaki is not turned over; you bake hemispheres of takoyaki, turn over takoyaki-ki itself and make the two corresponding iron plates face each other.
Old-style takoyaki is not turned over; you bake hemispheres of takoyaki, turn over Takoyaki-ki itself and make the two corresponding iron plates face each other.

sen.j: たこ焼き器を戻すと、鉄板の上に出来上がりのたこ焼きが残る仕組みとなっている。
sen.e: When you turn the takoyaki-ki back into its original position, complete balls of takoyaki are left on the iron plate.
When you turn the takoyaki-ki back to its original position, complete balls of takoyaki are left on the iron plate.
When you turn the Takoyaki-ki back to its original position, complete balls of takoyaki are left on the iron plate.

sen.j: このスタイルのたこ焼きは、阪神百貨店地下スナックパークなどで供されていたが、現在はなくなってしまった。
sen.e: Formerly this type of takoyaki was served in Snack Park on the basement of Hanshin department store, but it isn't any longer.

sen.j: これらの器具は、近畿圏で調理器具を扱っている店ならどこでも売られている。

sen.j: 本格的な物、あるいは業務用は日本橋 (大阪府)・千日前の道具屋筋に多く見受けられる。

sen.j: 2003年に遊戯施設のロッテワールド内で販売が始まり、「たこ焼きのうた」と共に人気を博し、韓国語カバーが出た。
sen.e: Takoyaki began to be sold in Lotte World, an amusement park, in 2003 and gained popularity along with "The Song of Takoyaki," which was translated into Korean.

sen.j: この曲のヒットと共にたこ焼きの人気が上がり、ソウル特別市市内各地に屋台が広がった。
sen.e: Takoyaki became more popular with the success of this song, and food wagons dealing in takoyaki spread all over Seoul.

sen.e: In 1990s a restaurant chain named "Ship of the Sun" was established, and began to sell takoyaki in the name of "Octopus small meatball."

sen.j: 中国
sen.e: China
China

sen.j: 日本式居酒屋のメニューにはあったが、2001年にやはり台湾の日の船「章魚小丸子」が中国大陸で法人を設立し、各大都市でのチェーン展開を進めている。
sen.e: Some Japanese-style izakaya bar had served takoyaki since early times, and in 2001 the Taiwanese enterprise Ship of the Sun "Octopus small meatball" established a corporation in the mainland China and started opening a far-reaching chain in big cities.

sen.j: ジョグジャカルタスルタン家の第1王女がPR活動で来日を重ねるうちに、たこ焼きの味と手軽さにほれ込み、2006年、ジョクジャカルタに第1号店を誘致。
sen.e: The first daughter of the Sultan of Jogjakarta got to like the taste and easiness of takoyaki as she frequently visited Japan for PR activities, and invited to open the first takoyaki restaurant in Jogjakarta in 2006.

The first daughter of the Sultan of Jogjakarta got to like the taste and easiness of takoyaki as she frequently visited Japan for PR activities, and invited the opening of the first takoyaki restaurant in Jogjakarta in 2006.
